curam.util.timer

Class TimerTask

  • java.lang.Object
    • curam.util.timer.TimerTask
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class TimerTask
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Contains information about a timer task.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      java.io.Serializable argument
      Optional: a struct parameter for the method being invoked.
      DateTime creationTime
      Read-only: the time at which this timer was requested.
      java.lang.String errorHandlerName
      Optional: the name of a class, which implements interface TimerCallback which will get called if the timed method fails.
      long initialDelay
      Read-only: the initial delay time in milliseconds which was specified when this timer was created.
      DateTime initialEventTime
      Read-only: the absolute time of the first event for this timer, or null if none was specified when this timer was created.
      long interval
      Read-only: the repeat interval which was specified when this timer was created, or zero if it is a one event timer.
      java.lang.String methodName
      Mandatory: the name of the method to invoke.
      long taskID
      Read-only: a unique identifier for each task.
      java.lang.String timerName
      Optional: a name for this timer.
      java.lang.String userID
      Read-only: the ID of the user who started off the task.

      Constructor and Description
      TimerTask() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      java.lang.String toString()
      Gets a string description of this task.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • methodName

        public java.lang.String methodName
        Mandatory: the name of the method to invoke.

      • argument

        public java.io.Serializable argument
        Optional: a struct parameter for the method being invoked.

      • timerName

        public java.lang.String timerName
        Optional: a name for this timer. This can be used as an identifier to query or cancel a timer.

      • errorHandlerName

        public java.lang.String errorHandlerName
        Optional: the name of a class, which implements interface TimerCallback which will get called if the timed method fails.

      • userID

        public java.lang.String userID
        Read-only: the ID of the user who started off the task. This gets automatically populated when the timer is started.

      • taskID

        public long taskID
        Read-only: a unique identifier for each task. This is automatically populated when the timer is requested.

      • creationTime

        public DateTime creationTime
        Read-only: the time at which this timer was requested. This is automatically populated when the timer is requested.

      • initialDelay

        public long initialDelay
        Read-only: the initial delay time in milliseconds which was specified when this timer was created.

      • initialEventTime

        public DateTime initialEventTime
        Read-only: the absolute time of the first event for this timer, or null if none was specified when this timer was created.

      • interval

        public long interval
        Read-only: the repeat interval which was specified when this timer was created, or zero if it is a one event timer.

        public TimerTask()
